page.title: 06Pilkingtons at Lathom
page.content: {Pilkingtons Research Laboratories} Pilkingtons do research into glass at Lathom. The department moved here in 1960 and employs up to 900 people. {Employees} Analytical chemists test samples of glass to see which chemicals are there. They use electronic equipment so that the amount of each chemical is shown on a computer screen and printers record the data. Engineers design furnaces for different kinds of glass. They first draw designs. The engineers make sure that the furnaces are put together properly. The furnaces are built in many countries and the engineers spend much of their time overseas. Pilkingtons have 50 acres of land around the labs. They have gardens for recreation and a pond for fishing. You can see Pilkingtons from all over the district.
